transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Are we still canoeing later?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quickly jerking head up) I'm awake! (sips his coffee)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No time for canoeing. We have a foundation to--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (interrupting) What was he about to say, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, we run a foundation for inner-city Chinese children, ehh, who we first fire-proof, and then we set 'em on fire to see if it worked -- and it often does.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh. People pay you for this?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: They pay us to put 'em out.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I was talking to Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I have a better foundation, but you'll have to miss your foundation activities if you want to see how good mine is.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, what's your foundation about?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't know because I don't-- I not know. But one thing's for sure, there's gonna be animals!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, where are the animals?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Umm, what animals?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) You see, Moltar...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Kids are more likely to trust their investments with animals.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We could just get some poor people and treat 'em like animals.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, write this down: No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Moltar, get me Lassie so I can raise money for retardos.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, how much money's come in?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (pointing at total) Uhh, none. None money.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That is such b.s. I told--

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, brother! Hey, brother!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You want to make a lot of money?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How? Blow this dog up?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Umm...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There's probably a lot of money in that.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Okay, yeah. Sure.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uhh, Moltar. Now how much money?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uhh... (garbled) none.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Get me a cuter animal!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay, I'm on it.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Good evening, folks. I don't know what to say--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hello, little fella! What's your name?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yes. Here we go.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in cutesy voice) What's your name, poochie?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Don't (BLEEP) with me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ooh, doggie's got teeth.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Get to the plug.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, my.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Get to the (BLEEP)ing plug already.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's your name, little fella?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Look, you want to know about the dog, you come over here and smell my ass like everybody else.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fair enough. (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: What's going on here? What are you--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bring it closer. (goes down again)

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (repositioning himself) Fine.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) This is the lowest point in my career since I was groped by that (BLEEP)ing ALF puppet.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Anyway... (lowers head, sighs)

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: What the hell?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (muffled) Mm hmm?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Are you kidding?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, hey.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Holy (BLEEP).

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, I don't have a cold, but my nose /is/ shoved up a dog's ass.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: What is this, eh?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm in space. Where'd you think I was?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: What, is that where we are? Space?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shh.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (mocking) Ooh, we're in outer space!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (popping up again) Please shut up, dog. I'm on the phone.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost-- Get to the plug.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (muffled) Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Let's talk about my beautiful singing voice.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I count seven creases.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hang on, I'll send you a picture.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Uhh... (flash goes off)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Did you get the picture?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Ehh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thank you. (invisos back to set, waves) That dog's ass had some great promotional offers.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Who watches this show?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't know.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Anybody?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not sure.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Seriously?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Seriously!

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: There's more heat on the crap I left in your dressing room than in this show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hang on. (into com) What do I want this dog to do, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (on com) I think you wanted him to be the mascot for your foundation.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: What, are you looking for a boyfriend now?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (into com) But I want Lassie to be the mascot for my foundation.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Lassie is dead.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Ahh, damn it.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: 12:15 on Sunday night, good for you. Holy (BLEEP).

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (into com) Can we rebuild him?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (on com) Uhh, I don't know. Maybe.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thank you. Good news, everybody. We're rebuilding Lassie. (to Triumph) You ever work with Lassie?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: If by "working" you mean "bang up the ass," yes, I have worked with her.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs nervously, to Zorak) Did you hear what that guy said?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (after a beat) No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He said he banged a dog up the you-know-what.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (after a beat) No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Can you say "bang a dog up the ass" on TV?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (after a long beat, nods) No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Anything happen?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Umm, I think some money came in.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really? Hang on. (clears throat) Okay. (to camera) I, too, banged a dog up the a--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, come on, Moltar. It's not like it was alive or anything.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: They can take you off the air for that kind of shit-- Er, I mean, stuff.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: When did you become such a puritan?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Can we talk about some of the songs for a second?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure, we can talk about anything.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So long as Sister Mary Moltar isn't in the room.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Tch, you're really digging yourself a really deep hole.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) A hole that I will bang my way out--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Calm down with this religion.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know, all this salty language, see, it ain't helping the foun--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All I know, Moltar, is I am trying to create a retardo-free society.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, you'll probably have the thanks of all the retarded people watching.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: They're not retarded, Moltar. "Retardo" is the name of the disease, okay? I named it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And tonight, with this cute little dog's help... we're going to find a cure.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Oh, yes. Oh, yes.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost--

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (looking at camera) What, is the song over? (dismounts white dog) Okay, okay. Nobody told me, nobody told me. Thanks, bitch.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nice!

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry, I thought the show...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Zorak) And this was your idea for show six.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Let's talk about something nice. Let's talk about my beautiful singing voice. Right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: We've got a lot of cool songs on the album that break the lid off the dog industry, like "Benji's Queer." Why don't you play a little of it, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Umm. You know, we...can't.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Why not, Mommy?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (offscreen) Screw him!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: There's just a lot of...

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (overlapping) I've got a song about him, too!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: ...questionable content.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yes!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Well, here's a question: Play the song or you're fired! (to camera) And when I say "fired," I mean your job will be given to someone who can bang it up the ass pro--

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Man, they will shut us down.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I bet Zorak doesn't care. Zorak, get in here! You're director now!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Now, wait a second. Wh-what about me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You will lick my shiny boots, for you are now my dog on a leash.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ahem. I'm ready to direct, sir. You'll need these headphones.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Zorak. Oh, (BLEEP).

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mm hmm. Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you have pets, Triumph, like the one I'm showing you?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Ehh, yeah, I've got a... Do worms in your ass count as pets?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hang on. (listening) Mm hmm?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good. Yes, they do.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: I've got about eight roundworm in there. Frederick is, eh, he's the shy one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (listening) Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: He just likes to eat.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I love to eat worms. Out of people's asses!

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Uhh, ehh, uhh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hold on, he's laughing.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Uhh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: On the subway.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: How did you get your job?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Moltar) Tell him, dog. (tugs leash) Tell him, dog.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uhh. Scooby Doo.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's a good dog.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: I'm familiar with Scooby and I used to work together for Frank Sinatra, yes. Every now and then we would help him bury hookers in the desert.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (listening) Good. Well, I run a pack of hookers. Mm hmm. What uh? Oh, yes. Weiner.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Uhh, whatever, man. (laughs) You're in trouble, my friend. You're going down faster than Benji did in the Snow Dogs' locker room. Have I mentioned that Benji's queer?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (listening) Well, I'm queer, too.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Uhh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mm hmm.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Yes, good observation from the space man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm here, I'm queer, get used to it.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Uhh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mm hmm. And I like to eat my own butt.

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (laughing) Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good. When I'm not killing hookers.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, Space Ghost, what are you saying?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up, dog. Eat your biscuit! (tugs leash)

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Is it true that Wonder Woman once violated you with--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (overlapping) Hang on, I just came up with a new slogan for my foundation. Who wants to hear it?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: Ahh, please.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (listening) Mmm. (tentatively) We moisten your dreams with man-urine?

transcript.speaker: Triumph
transcript.dialogue: (after a beat) Whatever you say with your out of space jargon--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (overlapping) Won't you help? Just 20 cents a day and (with more conviction) we moisten your dreams with... man-urine. Won't you help? I think I will.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Won't you help? (under his breath, quickly) Under the desk.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, Moltar, sprinkle my contribution on the children, so that they may dream.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ehh, I'm lost. How does this relate to curing retardos?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It doesn't, Moltar. Can't you see what I'm doing here? I'm holding my own urine in a cup because I have responsibilities. Won't you help?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, retardos, why can't you walk over here?You've been out mending fences, probably can't even walk now.But retardos, meet your warm, golden cure,'Cause you've been out mending fences where you'll never walk alone.So send me some money or I'll bang you up,Yes, I'll bang you right up your ass----------

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So retardos number one forever.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, if I could just have a moment of your time. Help us save a life, perhaps yours, drop by precious drop. Because we're all the same yellow color inside. Thank you. Only with your urine can we be curin', so please, get up and pee in a cup. And remember, retardos number one, forever.
